thread.title: Vegas woman abducted Monday found in New Mexico; 2 men questioned
thread.title_full: Vegas woman abducted Monday found in New Mexico; 2 men questioned | Las Vegas Review-Journal

author: MIKE SHORO
title: Vegas woman abducted Monday found in New Mexico; 2 men questioned
text:
A 28-year-old woman forcibly removed from a south valley apartment and “placed or thrown” into a vehicle early Monday was found alive in Northern New Mexico late Monday night, Las Vegas police said.
Law enforcement officers in New Mexico found a minivan matching the vehicle’s description provided by the Metropolitan Police Department , Lt. David Gordon said Tuesday morning.
They found the woman, Jane Priebe, inside and rescued her, Gordon said. She was injured, but police expected her to survive.
Jack Morgan, the 31-year-old man identified as a suspect, was taken into custody, Las Vegas police said.
Sgt. Chad Pierce, public information officer for the New Mexico State Police, said early Tuesday morning that the vehicle in question was found about 11:30 p.m. near Espanola, New Mexico, about 25 miles north of Santa Fe. Pierce said another man was taken into custody, but he could not provide additional details, as the investigation continues.
Las Vegas police were contacted shortly after 10:30 a.m. Monday and responded to an apartment complex at 4201 S. Decatur Blvd., Metro spokesman Danny Cordero said. The woman was wearing only her undergarments and appeared to have been bound and then dragged to the vehicle.
The woman was identified as Priebe. She was forced into a white, American-made minivan with a partial Texas plate “CT” on the front and back of the van, police said.
Police are investigating whether the kidnapping was random or the perpetrator knew the victim.
The FBI, California Highway Patrol, Nevada Highway Patrol, Arizona Department of Public Safety and law enforcement agencies in New Mexico assisted in the investigation.
Las Vegas police released a flier to post in hotel-casinos late Monday night that featured a driver’s license photo of Priebe and a recent photo of Morgan. The Nevada Department of Transportation posted messages on its electronic freeway signs to alert drivers to look for the van.
Police said there was one witness, who reported the incident.
Review-Journal reporter Lawren Linehan contributed to this story. Contact Mike Shoro at mshoro@reviewjournal.com . Follow @mike_shoro on Twitter.
Sleepy man attacks... Las Vegas police explain...
